title: Visa Abandons Planned Acquisition of Plaid After DOJ Challenge
sub_head: Justice Department sued in November to challenge $5.3 billion deal
body:
Visa Inc. is abandoning its $5.3 billion planned acquisition of Plaid Inc., a key player in the financial-technology space, in the face of a Justice Department antitrust lawsuit that challenged the deal.
The department sued to block the deal in November alleging the acquisition would allow Visa to unlawfully maintain a monopoly in the online debit-card market. Plaid, the government argued, was a nascent but important competitive threat to Visa, and eliminating that threat would lead to Â higher prices, less innovation and higher entry barriers for online debit services.
Visa initially vowed to fight the government, and a trial was scheduled for June in a California federal court.
Write to Brent Kendall at brent.kendall@wsj.com and AnnaMaria Andriotis at annamaria.andriotis@wsj.com
